intro: Polyalthia obtusa, commonly known as the white-flowered satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
